page.title: 13RAMSGATE RAILWAY STATION
page.content: This station is mainly a passenger and maintenance station.Not many trains are handled here but there are many sheds for maintaining trains to a high standard.Every 6 months trains enter Ramsgate to be serviced-seats are renewed,brake blocks renewed and in the special pits mechanical overhauls take place.There is a cleaning depot where carriages are sprayed with acid to eat away the dirt but not the paint!The internal bodywork is cleaned with detergent and special chewing gum remover clears all sticky problems! Most trains enter Ramsgate via Dover and Canterbury-35 trains use this route from London.45 trains leave London via Chatham terminating at Ramsgate.350 people work at the station.The original leverbox and hand levers to change points are still used.
